isis.stitle: NEWAY AD-123/246 DRIVE AXLE AIR SUSPENSIONS - MAINTENANCE - General

svcproc.title: General

step1.para: Build tractor air pressure above 65 psi. With tractor shut off, check system for air leaks (not shown).
Minimum clearance around air springs is 1 3/4 inches.
3/4 inch shock absorber nuts. Tighten upper shock absorber nuts to 70 to 80 ft-lbs. (95 to 108 N•m), and lower shock absorber nuts to 90 to 110 ft-lbs. (122 to 149 N•m).
Air spring mounting nuts, 1/2 inch and 3/4 inch. Tighten to 30 to 35 ft-lbs. (41 to 47 N•m).
A standard 1 1/8 inch pivot nut must be tightened to 600 to 650 ft-lbs. (813 to 881 N•m).
Check for proper installation of spacer washers at transverse beam and equalizing beam.
Transverse beam connection (2 1/4") must be tightened to 250 to 300 ft-lbs. (339 to 407 N•m), then bend (one) tab that aligns with flat surface of nut.
3/4 inch frame bracket mounting bolts tightened to 250 to 300 ft-lbs. (339 to 407 N•m).
Suspension air spring height should be within +/- 1/4 inch of specification. Refer to RIDE HEIGHT CAPACITY CHART.

svcproc.para: Daily or before each trip, check the suspension to be sure it is fully operational. Visually inspect air springs for sufficient and equal pressure and to see that suspension is set at proper air spring height. Refer to RIDE HEIGHT CAPACITY CHART, for air spring height measurement and re-setting instructions. Service as necessary.
